website_summaries.verdict: A great follow-up to the 5D and top-flight full-frame camera, the Canon EOS 5D Mark II delivers the fluid shooting experience and fine photos you expect from a professional model.
pros: good video capture capabilities and quality
cons: more direct controls would be nice
AF system could use an update

customer_reviews.title: Great all around still and movie camera
customer_reviews.text: I've been shooting with Canon since 1983. I've also shot medium & large format and have tried other brands but always come back to Canon. I've trusted their gear since the beginning and won't ever switch. The 5Dmk2 is my latest purchase and I'm impressed. While I could have bought a newer model I invested in better lenses. I've ALWAYS been happy with their glass. Buying a camera is important but a cheaper lens is going to give you acceptable images with a great camera. Red line glass (Canon's best glass) with an ok camera will give you great images.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Best Deal For A Perfect Cannon 5D Mark II
customer_reviews.text: Camera arrived in under two days, Even tho being used it was perfectly clean, came with all cables and extras packed as if it was brand new, honestly i could not tell it had ever been used! Great purchase, And i would absolutely recommend to anyone looking for a great deal on a Pro Camera!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: Buy an limited low-end camera? Or for the same price, buy the former pro photographers' choice ... that still works great. I have a Sigma art f1.4 20mm that I could never fully appreciate until I got this camera. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I use it as my primary camera on all shoots. I highly recommend getting this camera if you can't afford the newest models.
customer_reviews.author: Megan A.

customer_reviews.title: Buy with cation.
customer_reviews.text: Paid a lot of money, and I bought used. It was late coming but I’m sure that’s nobody but amazons fault or whoever delievered it. My cameras usb functions and external mic (the side of the camera) are not fuctional and I have to get that repaired. The camera does work and I love it. Perfect for people who need a pro camera.
customer_reviews.author: Demetri

customer_reviews.title: Advertised as refurbished. It came looking used without box
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as refurbished. It came looking used without box, software, or any of the related cables and user manual. The shutter button is very spongy and feels wore out. That being said, it does work well. I've taken over a thousand photos so far and all functions works as they should. I wouldnt recomend buying this camera used. I've had to return two that we're broke and didn't work upon arrival one being from Michigan camera
customer_reviews.author: joseph leal

customer_reviews.title: The 5D is a great camera but....
customer_reviews.text: I should’ve known better than to buy a refurbished camera because within a year this camera started having issues such as display window not showing information, functions not working. The company I purchased this from told me there was no extended warranty available after I contacted them. They couldn’t help me. Their only piece of advice was to bring the camera to a local camera shop and see if they can fix it. Great, thanks. I’ll never buy a used camera again.
customer_reviews.author: Boston guy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I don’t visually see any damage, except some minor dings on the outside of the body, but the camera itself won’t turn on. With a brand new charged battery it still doesn’t work. I’m reaching out to the seller and hoping to get a working exchange because I’d still like to have the product, just need one that works!
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. I was kind of weary buying a used camera but the seller sold what he claimed. Received the camera and is in excellent condition and had a low shutter count. I've had it for a couple months now and been using it. I definitely would recommend this sellers items being sold.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Happy upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This was a great upgrade to my rebel. You can tell a difference in clarity and picture quality! The price for this upgrade was awesome as well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Norwood

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, friendly to use and easy to learn the menus and functions.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for those interring further into DLSR photography. I love it's feel, the placement and ease of using the various adjustment buttons. It takes beautiful photos, even if I can't. The only drawback and Canon figured this out when they introduced the Mark III is the number of focusing points. This camera is limited and is a little difficult during auto focus, but once you learn its drawbacks you can work around them. Canon quit making this camera when they introduced the Mark III and that is a shame, it's a great all around camera for jumping into finer photography..If you decide on it, don't be afraid to look for a refurbished, or even used.
customer_reviews.author: G.B.

customer_reviews.title: Still one of the Best DSLR in 2020
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera... Canon 5D Mark ii still in 2020 One of the best DSLR. Not many new features we seen new models. But as camera it Make great photos. As photographer at the end if day that's all it matters... Anyone who is learning full frame consider 5D Mark ii.
customer_reviews.author: Wess

customer_reviews.title: Go to camera for many years.
customer_reviews.text: I just found out I never reviewed this, so getting caught up. Loved this camera. Used it professionally for years. The only reason I replaced it was to upgrade to the Mark III. Reason for upgrade, doing video work, better focus system, higher usable ISO. Great image quality, good build, full frame, low noise. Shot many a magazine spread with this beauty. I actually kept the Mark II around for over a year as a second camera as it is that good. If you find one used, don't hesitate do get one. Great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Farrell

customer_reviews.title: well cared  for bargain
customer_reviews.text: Very good shape for a camera of it's age. Very few actuations of the shutter. Well cared for and little used. It's very sturdy, and has a full frame sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: i love this camera , i debated getting the 5d Mark III for weeks before getting the Mark II , im so glad i got this camera , it is great and anyone that owns one will love it , it could have more focus points , but i can live with what it has , the lens that comes with the camera is wonderful the wide angle view has helped a lot , i dont have anything bad to say about the lens , anyway buy one , these Cameras are great , i thought i would have a problem going from a cropped to full frame , but it has been a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Kampbyll

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Camera arrived and has performed as expected. I always worry about used equipment, but the seller represented the camera accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Stamats

customer_reviews.title: Great used DSLR, solid upgrade from Canon Rebel crop frame
customer_reviews.text: Great camera upgrade from my entry level crop frame DSLR. Good price, and for being used it only had 69,000 shutters (I checked it via the free Windows app "EOSInfo" by astrojargon). On average, the lifespan is supposidly around 170,000 shutters.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Fine quality camera
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Canon 60D and 5D extensively and this 5D Mk2 is better than both. I have not used a Mk3 so I cannot comment on that but the Mk2 has impressed me so far. It has higher resolution than my 60D, and significantly higher resolution than my 5D. Controls and menus are much improved compared to the 5D, and as easy to use as my 60D. An added bonus is the 5D Mk2 uses the same battery as the 60D so there is no need for me to acquire extra batteries. I am impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: Doglet

customer_reviews.title: My only complaint is that the only focus point that ...
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that the only focus point that is 100% sure and accurate is the center point. All of the others are soft and very difficult to lock focus. If the camera wasn't so expensive to buy I would sell it and buy a Mark III or whatever is next on the horizon from Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Great full frame, cheaper than mark III
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded to the 5d Mark II from a Rebel T3i. I was considering purchasing the mark III, but the added cost was a large part in my decision to buy the II. I usually use the center AF point to focus an then recompose, and am not a sports photographer so the AF system on the mark 3 was not a huge plus. There are several other small things that are a little annoying that are fixed in the mark III (mic jack) but not enough to justify the additional $1400 premium to get them.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: I bought this camera 1 1/2 years ago and I love it
customer_reviews.text: I am a Landscape Photographer and I made the jump from Cropped sensor (40D) to the full frame a year and a half ago.. I Love my 5DMKII. The cost of the MKII over the MKIII is what spured me into buying this camera plus the addition of the 24-105 f-4 L series lens. Even when I upgrade my camera the lens will stay with me. 21mp is more than enough for large prints. If there is anymore of these cameras available you wont go wrong purchasing one..
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other positive reviews. There is not much to add other than saying that I am completely satisfied with the picture quality. Very well built and responds to my commands effortlessly. Canon EF 24-105L is useful lens that I use most often, but EF 16-35L that I had for some time is so much fun on it. The advantage of full-frame sensor is obvious. If you are after the best possible picture quality in wide range of conditions, you should consider Canon 5D Mark II as an option.
customer_reviews.author: Sushi Chef

customer_reviews.title: Everything you've heard about this camera is right.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a classic and it blows away my 7D. Lenses render sharper and the higher quality glass you feed it the better it gets. It's well built and the controls are easy to use. I wish the external battery grip was cheaper (as is the case with the 7D), but that's my only drawback. If you shoot sports, the autofocus is not adequate for that -- but you probably already know that. If you're a portrait shooter, I don't see any reason to get a 5DIII over the 5DII. Invest the difference in glass.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Geary

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The mirror fell out on first trial. will most likely send it back
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Canon 5D Mark II
customer_reviews.text: GREAT CAMERA! Full frame is everything they proclaim it to be. It is great for cropping because the field of view is much larger and the images are sharper. The ISO range offers bright, sharp images in dark situations with relatively little noise. The colors are correct every time. My lenses work so much better on this camera as well. The video recording, rear LCD focus and HDMI hookups are all pluses. Overall the camera is great to work with. Lots of pros on this camera, lots of learning, and lots of fun! The only con I have at the moment is the loud shutter noise it makes while shooting, but its the sound of greatness.
customer_reviews.author: R. E.

customer_reviews.title: Like new condition
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the camera for a few weeks and it works great. I’m Glad that I got for a grrat price.
customer_reviews.author: Lost-creek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera! I love it. I had it for 3 years now and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: JpTellezG

customer_reviews.title: The Best Camera Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first DSLR and so far it's been amazing. I can't believe how great this camera is. If you're a pro or a semi-pro like myself, this is the camera to get. Canon offers a really extensive selection of lenses and additional equipment. My only complaint is that the "special offers" for memory cards that appeared on the page with the camera were not the right cards for this camera. Amazon did have the best price, better than all the electronic stores in NYC.
customer_reviews.author: Reading is Life

customer_reviews.title: awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: I had a great time using this camera, It is a great camera and produces great images it is great first step into professional full frame camera. I have just completed some 84,000 clicks on this in two year and still works perfect. I am a sport and product photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Louis G. Pescevic

customer_reviews.title: $300 flat rare for repair KEH Camera
customer_reviews.text: Can some explain why this rubber thing on the grip came off and is it replacible? KEH Camera can’t help me anymore being that this thing’s warranty is done. Which really sucks. Their repair rate is $300 flat rate.
customer_reviews.author: Jae Tok

customer_reviews.title: Photographer's Dream Camera
customer_reviews.text: Packaged arrived within the alloted time frame and was well packaged. Signed for the packaged due to amount of the purchase. Bought as a gift for my son who was totally blown away when he opened the gift. He said it's probably the last camera he will need, it's very professional. Your pricing beat several other venues I checked out to make this purchase so a big thanks to you Amazon for making this gift possible. Ellen P.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen M. Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Love looks a lot like this.
customer_reviews.text: I've got nothing but love for this camera. I've been looking at it for years and finally got one. Huge upgrade from the T3i in durability, flexibility, and versatility. I can't believe how great photos look at high ISOs -got a beautiful shot at iso 4000 that I NEVER would have been able to do on my old camera. This body is legendary for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: iDex Media

customer_reviews.title: This is it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera since December and it is better than I thought it will be. I read the reviews before I bought in which people complained about the focus. It is true that you need to be much more careful about focus with this camera (I came from a 20D.) It's not that there's anything wrong with the camera. To the contrary, it's that the detail is so good that your focus mistakes show up more. Use good lenses, use good technique and the results you get will amaze you.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: beautiful camera!
customer_reviews.text: i love this camera! I'm still learning to improve my photography and want the next version of this camera- the 5DMIII is out but a new version should come out by the end of the year I would think? Anyways this is a great camera regardless!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy M. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: I used this camera for years and captured some amazing work, family
customer_reviews.text: I used this camera for years and captured some amazing work, family, and landscape pictures. You can't go wrong with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany GTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good dealer results.
customer_reviews.text: Had one, sold it, felt remorse, bought another. You have to be careful buying used, but I found the camera I bought from this dealer to be well described and an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RDKirk

customer_reviews.title: Mark ii
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, great price...if it worked properly. Since I purchased it, it's never worked in Aperture Priority mode. It took me a while to figure that out because I almost always shoot in manual mode. I'm assuming that means the light meter is broken. Anyway, it came like that. Very disappointing for when I really need AV to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scratched screen
customer_reviews.text: The camera was left on when I received it and it also had scratches all over the screen :( haven’t turned it on yet to check the quality. Fast shipping though.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to do too much playing around with it just yet, but it's certainly an upgrade from my last camera. It shipped quickly, and came in good condition. Overall, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: daniel r.

customer_reviews.title: They are a great cameras, high end full frame
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 canon 5d mkii, I use them for my wedding photography. They are a great cameras, high end full frame. They get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Alleykat13161

customer_reviews.title: Best thing Canon ever did
customer_reviews.text: I had the original 5D and shot weddings, portraits, landscapes, etc. As much as that was a great Camera, this is an improvement all around - Super fast, crisp, vibrant photos. Excellent in low light. Beautiful video as well, though you have to adjust the focus manually (which is difficult to do while trying not to be too shaky). It's the best toy I ever purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Burgess Family

customer_reviews.title: Thankkkkkkk youuuuuuuu!
customer_reviews.text: Idk what to say! Just wow. The quality is great n the condition of the Camera is superb. Thank you thank you thank you thank you.lol really appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Ssoliman855

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, low price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, camera fantastic upgrade from my previous eos rebel series. Highly recommend the 5D mkII, great price and if you are just taking pictures as opposed to video it’s fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with my camera! It was in really good condition. Have taken many picture with it without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: the camera and lense are great. The good reviews are accurate. The focus is good right out of the box,as long as you focus in the middle of the frame. You can then crop or recompose to get the picture you want. It is a bargain at current cost. Amazon delivered it promptly.
customer_reviews.author: R.C.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing images from this camera..
customer_reviews.text: Im a pro photographer that just sold my old 5d camera set up and bought this mark ii...it is night and day as far as the resolution ..colors and clarity of the images ...the 5d mark ii is all a pro will need for any job.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick Mauro Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Body is working great. Bought used and currently having no issues with it. This camera is a real work horse.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: After 4yrs, still loving my 5D Mark II
customer_reviews.text: I know the is a lot of excitement about the new Mark III this summer, but save yourself some real money and invest in a lens - grab the Mark II. Photos are fantastic and it is hard to find a better video camera. Only small issue, is the use of autofocus during shooting video is very limited and noisy if your use it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Heard

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my work even more!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a photojournalistic photographer. We mostly shoot weddings and the very first time I posted pictures using this camera I had many people comment on how much better my work looked! It is a great camera for indoor and outdoor and reasonably priced considering the huge jump up it was in quality compared to the 40d (which is what I had been using). We loved it so much we bought a second 5d mark ii body the same year!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Todd

customer_reviews.title: Filmmakers? This is your camera.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is phenomenal. I love the quality, the weight takes some getting used to if you come from lighter prosumer/consumer cameras. But, every time I use it, I fall in love over and over again. Great! Great with lowlight as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Modify

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This Camera is for Pros, i like it cause in Low Light, there is no much Digital Noise even when you raise the ISO Much..
customer_reviews.author: James Tembo

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome camera!!
customer_reviews.text: I was finally able to upgrade from the 5D to the 5D Mark II and couldn't be more thrilled. As a professional photographer, the high ISO capability alone on this camera is worth the purchase price. Canon continues to prove over and over that they are a premier camera manufacturer and I wouldn't shoot with any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: R. Journeay

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Full Frame
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year or two ago before the 5DmkIII was released and it's the only camera I use out of a small pile of Canon bodies. The only reason I still use a crop sensor camera is for the EF-S 17-55mm and extra distance out of my 400mm.
customer_reviews.author: Scuzzle Buddy

customer_reviews.title: great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Two years and still going strong. I used this to launch my career as a freelance photographer and it took awhile to get going but the camera is great! I have shot over 40,000 images and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Photojournalist's baby
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this camera in just about every way possible. As a photojournalist, being able to use the camera in any situation is a must, and this thing has performed well in literally any situation, even in near complete darkness. With the price drop on this body it is a no brainer to buy it! Build quality, image quality, high iso performance, autofocus system, video quality all get 5/5 stars for me. The only thing I kind of miss over my old 50D is the 6 frames per second but I have almost forgotten about that after a month with this body.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Smith

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Estou comprando minha segunda Canon. Depois da T2i, resolvi comprar uma full frame e optei pela 5DII. Uma câmera realmente incrível! Tenho duas lentes série L e percebo como foi um ótimo investimento. Sem dúvida uma excelente máquina, a tonalidade das fotos, os recursos de ISO e sua facilidade de uso são grandes destaques. I'm buying my second Canon. After the T2i, I decided to buy a full frame and I opted for the 5DII. A camera really amazing! I have two L series lenses and see how it was a great investment. Undoubtedly an excellent machine, the tone of the photos, the ISO capabilities and its ease of use are major highlights.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo R. Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Far better than the 40d I have been using.
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera. The back display really gives you an accurate view of the shots you've taken. I've used a 24-70l and 16-35l on it and the photos are of excellent quality. A good quality camera for the semi-pro photographer building on his equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definately a step up from my 40D
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I really want to get the new version but this camera really gave me that extra umph in clarity and image quality I was looking for. Also MUCH better in lower light than my 40D I was using.
customer_reviews.author: indysrider

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for a Canon Rebel XTi
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after hearing the awesome reviews and decided that since I needed an upgrade (my Rebel XTi's sensor went bad) that I would test it out. I cannot believe the photos I am taking! The sharpness and quality is perfect. The HD Video is more than I expected as well! I would recommend this product to any aspiring photographer or for those who take photos as a hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia H.

customer_reviews.title: Disenchanted
customer_reviews.text: I just received my 5D Mk2 less than two weeks ago. I have ran it through probably 2000 actuations and just today noticed a very obvious dead pixel. I have not exposed it to any harsh conditions, although I was hoping to be able to. I am sending it back for an exchange but I am very disappointed. I will re-review when I receive the replacement. I've been putting this off and finally jumped to get this camera and just don't know how to feel. I feel at bit cheated at this point, but we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: D. W. Balcom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: I got to this camera maybe a year or two late. Still comparable to the rest of the cameras out there. I use it mainly for video, so until blackmagic is more widely available, I won't be going away from it anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: FotoLyfe Studios

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Videos in high quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a beast. I love it. Videos in high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joao Felipe Braga de Carvalho

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera. I don't care about the wifi of ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera. I don't care about the wifi of the new models or recording video. I wanted a high quality full frame SLR and that's exactly what this is.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Parke

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: It's a 5DMkII. Too many people have reviewed it already. You know how good it is. Yes, even used like the one I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Joey P. NYC

customer_reviews.title: Better than I imagined!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my new camera since Friday (6 days ago) and love the results and ease of use! Live view is a great feature but if you are auto-focusing, hit the button on the top right of the back panel on the camera that says AF-ON before you click the shutter. Full frame is the way to go for professional results! Highly recommended for anyone upgrading from a semi-professional to professional camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality all the way around. Canon is one of the best digital cameras for the money. We have owned dozens of Canon's and two of them are the Mark II.
customer_reviews.author: Alwaysworking!

customer_reviews.title: In love.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth spending the extra $ for the 5DMiii. Used that money towards a few accessories: a tripod, flash, shutter release, bag, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from 50D to 5Dmkii
customer_reviews.text: I was scared to spend the money but when i received the camera i was pretty sure i had made the right decision. The menu system is very similar to the 50D so i was able to start making custom settings instantly. The 'bulb' setting is a welcome feature compared to the 50 and as is the 3 custom settings instead of 2. Image quality is awesome along with the full frame sensor to bring out the best of my L series lenses. Take the time to sign on to the canon registration since you get extra perks as a 5D owner.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Dalgleish

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Camera. Fast shipping and condition as described
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th 5D mark II that I have purchased. I am a full time photographer and use Canon exclusively. I have used the 5D series cameras and will be upgrading to the mark III soon. My only gripe with this body is the autofocus sensitivity. The mark III is much better, but at a price point that is nearly double...or at least was when I wrote this review. I had over 290,000 clicks on the last 5D2 that I retired, which is why I purchased this one again...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: I love this Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. I upgraded from a crop frame Canon to the MKII and I am very happy with this camera. It is a workhorse and is a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: bdering

customer_reviews.title: Deserves 5 star
customer_reviews.text: i wanted just to rate it but i guess i have to write something about product to be able to rate it. overall very good product and deserves 5 stars . do not know if there is a big difference between this and mark 3 , havent tried mk3 yet.
customer_reviews.author: Azi

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery more worn body then I thought but good working overall camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.jones

customer_reviews.title: Great reputation camera for good reason
customer_reviews.text: Too bad Canon has stopped making this camera, which has been the model for the industry since it was initially released. It still is a magnificent camera, and the pricing on it was far better than the replacement Mark III, but which is also an amazing camera, though heavier to lug around. If looking for a great camera that is rugged and reliable and very near as good as the Mark III, and the Mark III is beyond your spending limit, I'd look toward a used and reworked Mark II if you cannot find a new one.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Pilonero

customer_reviews.title: What a great DSLR. Even when I bought it and it ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great DSLR. Even when I bought it and it was used, the camera still produce great quality pictures. The previous owner took a good care of the 5D MK II. I'm glad that I bought it from him. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Ahmada

customer_reviews.title: Going full frame
customer_reviews.text: The camera turned out to be exactly and they posted it. Love the camera
customer_reviews.author: gary foster

customer_reviews.title: Okay... but not fabulous. Had focusing issues.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the one I bought, it had focusing issues. Purchased the 5D Mark III instead.
customer_reviews.author: JoyfulJourneys

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: OMG this is the best camera i ever bought. so fast and sharp image. great 21.1MP it's a lot better than 7d and t3i. great night time outdoor videos.
customer_reviews.author: wael elsedeki

customer_reviews.title: Canon does it better!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera! I am so pleased with the picture quality. I am not a pro but my pictures look great!
customer_reviews.author: B. Lyn

customer_reviews.title: fantastic camera !!!
customer_reviews.text: I still haven't justified upgrading to the Mark III yet. This camera has all the functionality I need and more.
customer_reviews.author: Fly Fishing the World

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I lusted after it forever... rented it a couple times. Have shot with it for over a year and simply love the gorgeous images and stunning video! Kinda sad that they have discontinued it..... hope it's offspring can carry on the great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a 5D series Canon for years, since digital photography really took off, and this camera from AMAZON was a great deal. It works great, and shipped fast. I got it at a great price, thanks AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Best. Camera. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I made the plunge and decided to buy this camera after two years of wanting it. It's everything I hoped for! The video/image quality is outstanding and I'm extremely impressed.
customer_reviews.author: HBS53913

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.text: When you have the 5d mark ii you feel you have a real camera in your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Good Condition. Very seldom and randomly the shutter will ...
customer_reviews.text: Good Condition. Very seldom and randomly the shutter will drop making it so you can't photograph, but after a short minute it goes away. But again very rarely compared to how much I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera Ever
customer_reviews.text: Had a little trouble with the shipping, but it sounds like it was an unfortunate series of events. Once the camera arrived everything was great. Takes beautiful pictures. Need to save and invest in decants lenses to go with it. Focus can be hard to get at times. But it takes shots so quickly that it doesn't really matter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Scavo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera.
customer_reviews.text: I just graduated from a 60D to a 5D mark II. This is one of the best full frame cameras on the market. I will continue to use this camera for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: sincealways

customer_reviews.title: love the image quality
customer_reviews.text: you don't need a flash in lower light shooting situations. excellent image quality. it has been used for several group shoots in the last three weeks. very happy with it performance.
customer_reviews.author: brent bunderson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Forgot to write this guy a review, a few years back. But everything was as he said.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sauceda

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy with my new 5D
customer_reviews.text: Takes amazing photo's, the color and clarity are far better than anything I have ever had. Going to an inside event tonight and can't wait to see how my shots come out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera it is a big upgrade from the my T3i. The images are great and the video is awesome. I added a battery grip to the camera that works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas49

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great. It came in Chinese but I googled how to change the language and now it's great.
customer_reviews.author: CWhiteside

customer_reviews.text: This camera is my favorite, go-to camera. It's light, well-designed and durable and of course takes extremely high quality pictures.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.text: I already had a Canon 5D body that I have used for about six years and have loved. This was just an upgrade...which I am already starting to thoroughly enjoy. I haven't had it much more than a month but so far no surprises. It is a great up grade for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love my camera! This is my primary camera for my photography studio.
customer_reviews.author: Lawman

customer_reviews.title: Real Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've previously owned G5, 350D and 40D. 5D Mark II is of completely different league. Full-frame is amazing. I've had this for a few weeks and I am still completely amazed at the quality of material I get from this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: You know it's a good camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure you've read through review after review, so I won't bore anyone with technical specs. I wanted to upgrade to a full frame and couldn't decide which to get. At the time the new 5D Mark III just came out and the 6D was on it's way. Amazon had this for a great price and I couldn't pass it up. Obviously you can't go wrong with this camera and I've been completely happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: What a great camera
customer_reviews.text: I love Canons and the 5D does not disappoint. It is my second. I use it for landscapes and portraits and the quality of the images are A1 Highly recommended - unless you need super-fast fps's then this is a great solid work-horse
customer_reviews.author: rob coomber

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful piece of equipment. I'd buy a second one if I had the money right now. Full frame is definately the way to go. Auto focus is a little on the slow side compared to my 40D but that is the only complaint. For the majority of what I photograph it is not that important.
customer_reviews.author: G. Robinette

customer_reviews.title: Camera is amazing! In amazing condition
customer_reviews.text: Camera is amazing! In amazing condition, minus the fact that the USB port does not work. But besides that, it was exactly as described and the shipping was incredibly fast. I was super impressed by it's speed and I would order again.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Keller

product_meta.title: Canon EOS 5D Mark II 21.1MP Full Frame CMOS Digital SLR Camera with EF 24-105mm f/4 L IS USM Lens (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Style:5D Mark II 24-105mm Lens| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Canon 2764B004 EOS 5D Mark II 21.1MP Digital SLR Camera with EF 24-105mm f/4L IS USM Lens includes a the Mark II digital SLR camera that has a stunning 21.1-megapixel full-frame CMOS sensor with DIGIC 4 Image Processor, a vast ISO Range of 100-6400, plus EOS technologies like Auto Lighting Optimizer and Peripheral Illumination Correction. It supports Live View shooting, Live View HD videos, and more. It can shoot up to 3.9 fps, has 9 AF points plus 6 AF assist points, a new 98% coverage viewfinder, a 3.0-inch Clear View LCD (920,000 dots/VGA) and a rugged build. The EF 24-105 IS Lens is a standard zoom lens that can cover a large zoom area ranging from 24mm wide-angle to 105mm portrait-length telephoto. And its Image Stabilizer technology steadies camera shake up to three stops.

AMAZON.COM


 Compact, lightweight with environmental protection, EOS 5D successor boasts a newly designed Canon CMOS sensor, with ISO sensitivity up to 25,600 for shooting in near dark conditions. The new DIGIC 4 processor combines with the improved CMOS sensor to deliver medium format territory image quality at 3.9 frames per second, for up to 310 frames. 

Triggered from Live View Mode, HD video capture allows users to shoot uninterrupted at full 1080 resolution at 30fps -- for amazing quality footage with outstanding levels of detail and realism. 

The integration of HD movie capability into a high-end 21.1-megapixel camera opens a multitude of new possibilities for photojournalists and news photographers. With its full-frame CMOS sensor and outstanding ISO performance, the EOS 5D Mark II will appeal to any photographer in search of the finest camera equipment available -- from studio and wedding to nature and travel photographers. 

Other improvements to the EOS 5D include: 

 *  Addition of Canon’s EOS Integrated Cleaning System, with a new Fluorine coating on the low-pass filter 
 * Larger 3.0-inch Clear View LCD with VGA resolution, a 170-degree angle of view and anti-reflective coatings 
 * Improved menu system including Quick Control Screen for more direct access to common settings 
 * Automatic peripheral illumination correction, utilizing detailed EF lens information to optimize JPEG images straight out of the camera 
 * Magnesium alloy construction with additional environmental protection 
 * UDMA memory card compatibility 

EOS 5D Mark II Highlights 

New CMOS sensor
The EOS 5D Mark II’s newly designed full-frame 21.1-megapixel CMOS sensor features ISO sensitivity from 100-6400, expandable to 50, 12,800 and 25,600. Large 6.4µm2 pixels have been redesigned to capture more light and yield a better signal to noise ratio to ensure lower noise images throughout the ISO range. The full frame sensor has the same dimensions as a frame of 35mm film. This means that wide-angle lenses stay wide, without the change in angle of view associated with smaller sensor cameras. As well as benefiting from finer control over depth of field, photographers moving up to the EOS 5D Mark II’s full frame format will find the newly designed wide, bright 98 percent coverage viewfinder on a joy to work with. 

New DIGIC 4 processor
A new DIGIC 4 processor combined with 14-bit analogue to digital conversion provides smooth gradations in mono-tonal areas such as skies, and highly accurate color rendition. As well as HD movie shooting, DIGIC 4’s high speed provides for long uninterrupted continuous bursts of large JPEGs, near-instant start-up times and immediate and fast review after shooting. DIGIC 4 also provides for improved noise reduction algorithms, complementing the already low-noise images from the EOS 5D Mark II’s CMOS sensor. 

HD video capture
The EOS 5D Mark II is Canon’s first DSLR to incorporate full HD 1920x1080 video capture. Once filming is started from Live View mode, photographers can fire off either single of continuous stills, with video capture continuing after the final frame is captured. 

See everything
A new 3.0-inch VGA resolution LCD provides a wide 170 degree angle-of-view, providing plenty of clarity for accurate focus checks in playback. The screen brightness can automatically adjust to suit viewing conditions, extending battery life in low light and improving viewing in bright conditions. A new dedicated Live View button switches modes to display a real-time image on the LCD. This allows EOS 5D Mark II photographers to enjoy simplified shooting from awkward angles. Simple connection to a PC provides easy remote shooting. 

Precision focus and metering
A 9-point auto focus system is supported by 6 additional invisible Assist AF points, located inside the spot-metering circle to optimise subject tracking performance in AI SERVO AF mode. For accurate exposure readings in tricky lighting conditions, the spot metering circle covers just 3.5 percent of the frame. 

Control
The EOS 5D Mark II’s redesigned menu system includes a new Quick Control screen, for instant access to the most commonly changed settings. A new Creative Auto mode allows photographers to cede control of key settings to the camera, while retaining control over creative variables such background blur, drive mode and image brightness. Custom user settings allow photographers to switch between two completely different camera setups. This is ideal for changing quickly between two different environments, such as switching from working inside a church without flash to outdoors with fill-flash at a wedding. 

Optional Accessories
Shooting flexibility is enhanced with a range of new accessories. Shooting capacity can be extended with either the high-capacity 1800mAh lithium-ion Battery Pack LP-E6, or Battery Grip BG-E6. 

A new optional Wireless File Transmitter
The WFT-E4 offers external HDD and GPS compatibility along with ability to transmit images direct to computer or FTP server, or operate the camera wirelessly. Both the BG-E6 and WFT-E4 feature a vertical orientation shutter release and other key controls for comfortable portraiture work, with a substantial grip to help balance the camera when used with long lenses. 

What's in the Box  * EOS 5D Mark II Body 
 * Canon EF 24-105mm f/4 L IS USM lens 
 * Eyecup Eb 
 * Wide Neck Strap EW-EOS5DMKII 
 * Stereo Video Cable STV-250N 
 * USB Interface Cable IFC-200U 
 * Battery Charger LC-E6 
 * Battery Pack LP-E6 
 * EOS Digital Solution Disk 
 * Software Instruction Manual 





REVIEW FROM DPREVIEW.COM


 

Learn more about this camera
at DPReview.com Canon EOS 5D Mark II Digital SLR: Highly Recommended by dpreview.com 

Back in August 2005 Canon 'defined a new DSLR category' (their words) with the EOS 5D. Unlike any previous 'full frame' sensor camera, the 5D was the first with a compact body (i.e. not having an integral vertical grip) and has since then proved to be very popular, perhaps because if you wanted a full frame DSLR to use with your Canon lenses and you didn't want the chunky EOS-1D style body then the EOS 5D has been your only choice. Three years on and two competitors have turned up in the shape of the Nikon D700 and Sony DSLR-A900, and Canon clearly believes it's time for a refresh. 

So here is the 5D Mark II, which punches high in terms of both resolution and features, headlining: 21 megapixels, 1080p video, 3.0-inch VGA LCD, Live view, higher capacity battery. In other words, a camera that aims to leapfrog both its direct rivals, either in terms of resolution (in the case of the D700) or features (in the case of the DSLR-A900). Full detail below. 

Key features / improvements  * 21 megapixel CMOS sensor (very similar to the sensor in the EOS-1Ds Mark III) 
 * Sensor dust reduction by vibration of filter 
 * ISO 100 - 6400 calibrated range, ISO 50 - 25600 expansion (1Ds Mark III & 5D max ISO 3200) 
 * Auto ISO (100 - 3200) in all modes except manual 
 * 3.9 frames per second continuous shooting 
 * DIGIC 4 processor, new menus / interface as per the EOS 50D 
 * Image processing features: Highlight tone priority, Auto lighting optimizer (4 levels), High ISO noise reduction (4 levels), Lens peripheral illumination correction (vignetting correction) 
 * RAW and SRAW1 (10 MP) / SRAW2 (5 MP) 
 * RAW / JPEG selection made separately 
 * Permanent display of ISO on both top plate and viewfinder displays 
 * AF micro adjustment (up to 20 lenses individually) 
 * Three custom modes on command dial, Creative Auto mode 
 * Image copyright metadata support 
 * 98% coverage viewfinder (0.71x magnification) 
 * 3.0" 920,000 dot LCD monitor with 'Clear View' cover / coatings, 170° viewing angle 
 * Automatic LCD brightness adjustment (ambient light sensor) 
 * Live view with three mode auto-focus (including face detection) 
 * No mirror-flip for exposures in Live View if contrast detect AF selected 
 * Movie recording in live view (1080p H.264 up to 12 minutes, VGA H.264 up to 24 mins per clip) 
 * Two mode silent shooting (in live view) 
 * New jump options in play mode 
 * HDMI and standard composite (AV) video out 
 * Full audio support: built-in mic and speaker, mic-in socket, audio-out over AV (although not HDMI) 
 * IrPort (supports IR remote shutter release using optional RC1 / RC5 controllers) 
 * UDMA CompactFlash support 
 * New 1800 mAh battery with improved battery information / logging 
 * New optional WFT-E4 WiFi / LAN / USB vertical grip 
 * Water resistance: 10 mm rain in 3 minutes 

>Read more at dpreview.com 



See more
feature_bullets: 21.1-megapixel full-frame CMOS sensor, 14-bit A/D conversion, wide range ISO setting 100-6400
Includes Canon EF 24-105mm f/4 L IS USM lens
DIGIC 4 Image Processor; high-performance 3.9 fps continuous shooting; Live View Function for stills
Full HD video capture at 1920x1080 resolution for up to 4GB per clip ; HDMI output
Updated EOS Integrated Cleaning System specifically designed to work with a full-frame sensor
